intro: Dicranostyles villosa var. lasiocalyx, commonly known as the hairy dicranostyles, is a variant of the dicranostyles plant characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands or stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The flowers are small and clustered, often white or pale green, and appear in late spring to early summer.
